alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:39AM EDT until July 12 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy rain from yesterday will combine with additional rainfall today to continue flooding over the warned area. The Ashuelot River and its tributaries will remain high with minor flooding expected. Some roads and properties near the river and streams will continue to see flood impacts into this evening. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 AM EDT, Much of this region has seen between 3 and 5 inches of rain over the past 24 hours. Local law enforcement reported numerous roads remain closed in the region due to flooding. Additional showers and embedded thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and early evening, which could add 1 to 3 inches or more rain possible in the warned area today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Henniker, Swanzey, Winchester, Antrim, Hancock, Bradford, Dublin, Hinsdale, Richmond and Harrisville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
